IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CCAD IS A FOUR YEAR COLLEGE OFFERING A BACHELOR OF FINE ARTS AND A MASTER OF FINE ARTS DEGREES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: COLUMBUS COLLEGE OF ART AND DESIGN, A PRIVATE, FOUR YEAR, DEGREE-GRANTING INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, PREPARES TOMORROW'S CREATIVE LEADERS FOR PROFESSIONAL CAREERS. WITH A HISTORY OF COMMITMENT TO FUNDAMENTALS AND QUALITY, CCAD ADVANCES A DISTINCT, CHALLENGING, AND INCLUSIVE LEARNING CULTURE THAT SUPPORTS INDIVIDUAL DEVELOPMENT IN ART, DESIGN, AND THE HUMANITIES.
IRS990.Description: PROFESSIONAL ART EDUCATION, LEADING TO A BFA OR MFA DEGREE FOR AN ENROLLMENT OF 1,360 STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: For the year ended June 30, 2010, the College adopted the provisions of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification relating to uncertain tax positions. The implementation had no impact on the College's statement of financial position or statement of activities. The College does not believe its financial statements include any uncertain tax positions. The College is no longer subject to income tax examinations by the U.S. federal, state and local tax authorities for fiscal years ending 2007 and prior.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE POLICY IS PUBLICIZED THROUGH THE NEWSPAPER.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE FOLLOWING ARE GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS IN WHICH THE SCHOOL PARTICIPATES AND FROM WHICH IT RECEIVES THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REFERRED TO IN THIS SECTION:A. FEDERAL PELL GRANT PROGRAMB. FEDERAL PERKINS LOANC. FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANTD. FEDERAL STAFFORD STUDENT LOAN PROGRAME. FEDERAL UNSUBSIDIZED STAFFORD STUDENT LOANF. FEDERAL COLLEGE WORK-STUDY PROGRAM G. FEDERAL PLUS LOAN PROGRAM - PARENT LOAN FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTSH. OHIO NATIONAL GUARD SCHOLARSHIPI. WAR ORPHANS SCHOLARSHIP - STATE OF OHIOJ. VETERANS ADMINISTRATION BENEFITSK. BUREAU OF VOCATIONAL REHABILITATIONL. PENNSYLVANIA STATE GRANT PROGRAMM. OHIO ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPN. OHIO COLLEGE OPPORTUNITY GRANT

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: TUITION WAIVERS FOR FACULTY, STAFF AND OTHER INSTITUTIONS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE RELATIVE ONLY TO THE PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWARD TO BE GRANTED. VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS CAN BE AWARDED BASED ON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT, THE STUDENT'S YEAR IN SCHOOL, OR ANY OTHER REQUIREMENT THAT MAY BE SPECIFICALLY NOTED IN AN ENDOWMENT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE SPOUSE OF THE CEO INFREQUENTLY ACCOMPANIES HIM TO FUNDRAISERS AND BUSINESS MEETINGS AT WHICH THE SPOUSE'S PRESENCE IS EXPECTED. THE CEO'S HOUSING ALLOWANCE IS INCLUDED IN HIS W-2 WAGES, AND IS RELATED TO THE USE OF THE PERSONAL RESIDENCE FOR COLLEGE FUNCTIONS. PAYMENTS FOR THE BUSINESS USE OF PERSONAL RESIDENCE ARE RELATED TO COLLEGE FUNCTIONS. THE COLLEGE EITHER PAYS THESE EXPENSES DIRECTLY OR REIMBURSES THE CEO FOR EXPENSES HE HAS INCURRED. DOCUMENTATION IS REQUIRED FOR ALL REIMBURSEMENTS. SOCIAL CLUB DUES ARE PAID FOR THE CEO. THESE CLUBS ARE USED FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A MASTER OF FINE ARTS DEGREE WAS ADDED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONTROLLER, CFO AND PRESIDENT REVIEW THE 990. IN ADDITION, A DRAFT OF THE 990 IS EMAILED TO THE BOARD BEFORE IT IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COLLEGE'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FORM DETAILING THEIR BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS AND THOSE OF THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILY, AS WELL AS BOARD APPOINTMENTS, ETC. WHEN MATTERS OF POTENTIAL CONFLICT DO ARISE, THEY ARE ADDRESSED OPENLY DURING BOARD COMMITTEE MEETINGS OR FULL BOARD MEETINGS, AND WHERE INDICATED, MEMBERS RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM DISCUSSIONS OR VOTES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CEO COMPENSATION IS CONSIDERED ANNUALLY, FOLLOWING FORMAL REVIEW BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF THE EXECUTIVE'S PERFORMANCE. THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS ARE RECORDED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. THE COLLEGE IS A MEMBER OF A NATIONAL CONSORTIUM OF 40 PRIVATE, INDEPENDENT COLLEGES OF ART AND DESIGN FROM THE U.S. AND CANADA; THIS CONSORTIUM PROVIDES ITS MEMBERS WITH AN ANNUAL DATA REPORT DETAILING COMPARATIVE STATISTICS RANGING FROM ENROLLMENT, COST-OF-ATTENDANCE, AND COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS FOR ALL EXECUTIVE STAFF. THIS DATA, IN ADDITION TO WHAT IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE CHRONICLE OF HIGHER EDUCATION, IS UTILIZED BY THE BOARD IN CONSIDERING COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO. THE PERFORMANCE OF KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY AND WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION IS PROVIDED. THE SAME MECHANISM OF DATA AND METRICS UTILIZED FOR THE CEO INFORM THE COMPENSATION DECISIONS AFFECTING OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's Forms 990 is available upon request. Further, the form is available via another's website, www.guidestar.org.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT, AND ANNUAL AUDIT ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
